com.liavontsibrechka.wit4j.communication

Class HttpCommunication

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.liavontsibrechka.wit4j.communication.HttpCommunication
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Converse

    public abstract class HttpCommunication
extends Object
    This class is responsible for defining an abstract structure of making http requests and handling http responses (json files) using Wit.ai HTTP API in order to communicate with bot.
    Since:
    1.0-SNAPSHOT
    Author:
    Liavontsi Brechka

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String baseUrl
      Base url of Wit.ai HTTP API.
      protected URL finalUrl
      URL for actual request (baseUrl + all necessary parameters)
      protected HttpURLConnection httpConnection
      Http connection that is responsible for setting request headers and body as well as reading response.
      protected static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper jsonMapper
      Object for handling JSON files in java using Jackson API.
      protected static String version
      Wit.ai HTTP API versioning parameter.

      HttpCommunication()

    • Method Detail

      • sendHttpRequest

        public abstract com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode sendHttpRequest(String message)
                                                                 throws IOException
        Prepares and sends http request to bot API.
        Parameters:
        message - message provided by user input (May be null).
        Returns:
        JSON response from Wit.ai HTTP API.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        JsonNode

      • handleHttpResponse

        public abstract void handleHttpResponse(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode httpResponse)
                                 throws IOException
        Handles JSON response that is returned by appropriate sendHttpRequest method call.
        Parameters:
        httpResponse - JsonNode object that represents JSON response of sendHttpRequest call.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        JsonNode
